page.title: 15'MUCHTY..DISUSED QUARRY
page.content: Rossie Den quarry, east of 'Muchty, was worked untill the 1960's. It is partly owned by Bell Bros (Newburgh) Ltd., who took over Adamson brothers who worked the basalt quarry, and by Mr. Storrar of Rossie Farm. The old quarry is quite well screened from the A 91 cupar to auchtermuchty road by deciduous trees, mainly sycamores and hawthorn bushes.After the quarry was closed, it was used by people on motorbikes, as a scrambling area.The quarry was also used as an unofficial tip untill 1983 when it was fenced off and notices were put up to inform people not to dump their rubbish.Unfortunately, due to this unofficial dumping, quite pleasant area has been turned into an unpleasant area. In the future the quarry will probably be reclaimed.
